answers.answer: HI-I'm sorry to hear about your struggles.  There's many things that can be going on medically to up your risk of having miscarriages -do you have a GP that you like that you could talk to about this?  I'm also on the thyroid forum because I have Graves disease which puts women at a much higher risk for miscarriage and preeclampsia.  Do you have any symptoms like quick weight loss despite avid appetite, unexplained weight gain, dry itchy skin, hair falling out, trouble falling asleep or staying asleep, anxiety, hand tremors, rapid heart beat, depression.This might not be your problem at all, but I thought it was worth mentioning!  Good Luck and Keep us Posted!

question: I had a miscarriage in October of 2010 and been trying to get pregnant since January 2011. What's going on, should I go see a doctor?Thank you for your time.
title: Why am I having a difficult time getting pregnant?
